Love Island Australia is back!

After becoming a hit Down Under, the Aussie version of the ITV2 dating smash returns tonight for its second season.

Ahead of the premiere, the show's tweeted an all new teaser introducing this year's boys.

Host Sophie Monk calls out names as the boys saunter, jog and swagger into the villa.

"This is Gerard!" the blonde beauty tells the assembled ladies.

Sophie also introduces Adam, Sam, Matthew and Maurice.

"Uh-oh," says tattooed Adam, "Here's trouble!"

Maurice takes one look at the girls and shouts: "Is it my birthday? Cos it feels like it!"

The show is more or less the same as the UK version - with one big difference.

(Image: Channel 9)

(Image: Channel 9)

This year the show will all be filmed in the sun-drenched Pacific Island of Fiji.

Last year's was shit in Mallorca, the same as the UK edition.

Head of Entertainment for ITV Studios Majiella Wimers revealed to The Daily Telegraph : "We still have a crew of casting agents back in Sydney who are selecting contestants while the show's on air to come into later episodes.

(Image: Channel 9)

(Image: Channel 9)

"We can be more reactive and send someone in within 48 hours if we think they'd be good for the villa."

Last year's show was a hit with Australian audiences, and season two's cast is sure to have people chatting away.

The first boy to be introduced, Gerard, is a personal trainer from Perth, who's also been a nudist for years.

Tall Matthew is a model, but is also a professional wrestler.

Party girl Cassie insists she wants to settle down, while Tasmanian beauty Jessie boasts 54,000 Instagram followers.

Born-again Christian Cartier stirred the pot in her teaser video when she expressed some controversial views on gender roles.

The 19 year-old said: "The woman's role in a relationship is to take care of their man. Cook for them, clean for them."
description: The Australian edition of Love Island returns tonight for it's second season, and the show's put out a fresh teaser showing off the male cast members
